bio.experienceSummary:
Experienced nanny and former teacher looking for part-time/weekend babysitting opportunities. 

Hello parents! My name is Janaina, I'm 29 years old and I am a former teacher who has been working as nanny for the past 6 years (9+ years of experience working with children). I provide reliable care for children and peace of mind for parents who will know their little ones will be safe, loved and have someone who truly cares and enjoy children around them. I'm a great caring nanny who is into child development and loves her job. 
I have experience with multiple kids, CPR/First Aid trained, driver's licence with clean records and driving experience in the city, college degree, speak Portuguese and English fluently (I'm originally from Brazil) and have taken care of children from the ages of 6 months to 13 years old. I'm vaccinated and boosted. I have excellent references that will be provided upon request. 
My rate starts at 28$ to 40$ and open to nanny share or exclusivity.

Hi, my name is khaylie I'm 20 years old. I'd describe my personality as responsible, sweet, proactive. I like to create activities for my kids and always practice Spanish with them!

Working with kids is one of my passion. I learn from them every day and being part of their live and education is always a honor. 

 I have 3 years of experience with different ages. I have good references. 

In my free time I dance at Broadway dance academy and in a future I'm planning to be a veterinarian.

description.originalText: Khaylie is a very sweet and gentle person. She’s very energetic and has help me many times with my 4G. She has helped me beyond her duties and always has a very good actitud preparing activities for her.

bio.experienceSummary: I have had over 10 years of experience working with kids of all ages! I have years of childcare experience, most recently working part time as a nanny for a family with 2 kids (age 5 and 8) and can provide a reference from them! I have tons of experience babysitting children of all ages from as young as 3 months to 10 years old, along with having experience working as a theater camp instructor for 3 years with kids ages 6-16. Before that, I worked as a dance teacher for 4 years teaching children ages 3-7 tap and ballet. I love kids and as the oldest of 10 cousins, I am comfortable multitasking and watching multiple kids at once. I am also great with pets. I am fully vaccinated and boosted and have first aid/CPR training. I have a pretty open schedule and am flexible with my availability!

Hello! I'm a nanny looking for a reliable and nice family for a long term commitment if it's possible! I'm very crafty and creative and I really enjoy planning fun activities. I love working with kids they're too funny and I am learning every day about them. 
I have 6 years of experience working with kids of all ages. I'm in my second year as a babysitter here in New York! So excited. 
I worked in a summer camp for 4 seasons and I was a babysitter for 5 years in Argentina. I'm a Spanish native speaker who loves sharing her culture and language. I'm certificated in CPR and first AID. I can prepare healthy meals, do laundry once or twice a week. I also have a New York driver's license and I'm pet friendly!!
I can send you my resume with excellent references! Thank you

description.originalText: Mara was taking care of our kids for 5 months. It was very helpful! She’s very responsible and adorable person. We love her!!

bio.experienceSummary: Hi!! My name is Sophie. I am a graduate of The University of Central Oklahoma's Musical Theatre program and moved from Texas to NYC in 2022 to pursue acting. I live in Sutton Place with my husband and our sweet pup, Fran. I have nannied for several families, run a daycare at a workout studio, and am a part of a big family with lots of kids always around. I am comfortable caring for children from infancy through teenage years and would be happy to assist in other tasks as requested. I maintained a 4. 0 GPA all four years of college through my organization skills, hard work, and discipline. I am great at playing pretend, supervising and assisting arts and crafts, and as a former picky eater, I am a great cook and baker for even the most selective kids. I worked as a party princess for several years and kids are usually drawn to me. No vehicle, but I do have a driver's license and experience driving kids in NYC. I would love to get to know your family and help you out in any way I can.

description.originalText: I can't say enough good things about Sophie. From the moment she began caring for our then-5-month-old, it was clear that she was the right fit - she brought so much love, energy, and humor to work every day (and a huge smile). Sophie felt more like a trusted friend than a hired caregiver, but she was still incredibly professional and I could quickly and easily offer feedback on minor adjustments or preferences as she continued to learn/grow. Grateful to have crossed paths with Sophie. (Side note - she's an unbelievably talented singer!)

bio.experienceSummary:
Hello, my name is Rubaba, and I'm a patient, calm, creative, friendly, and approachable childcare provider. I've always had a passion for working with children, which motivated me to complete my bachelor's degree in Computer Science at John Jay College.

With three years of childcare experience and coursework in early childhood development, I'm equipped to provide a nurturing and educational environment for your child. I believe in open communication and will provide written daily reports, as well as verbal communication at pickup and regular updates via text or phone call, to keep you informed about your child's day.

Whether it's playing outdoor sports, engaging in board games and puzzles, or participating in educational games that promote learning, I'm always looking for fun and interactive ways to keep children engaged and entertained. I'm also comfortable enforcing household rules and helping with cooking, meal preparation, and light housekeeping.

Hi there! My name is Caroline. I currently work at a tech start-up and in theatre but am also looking for occasional babysitting opportunities. I have many years of experience working with children in a variety of settings and ages from 4 months old to 12 years old. I used to teach dance, acting, and singing classes to children ranging from preschool to middle school. During the pandemic, I worked as a full-time nanny and tutor, assisting elementary-aged children with online learning and daily care. I have also worked as a mother's helper, helping with meal prep, organizing, cleaning, and general household support. I am available for occasional or recurring weekend and weeknight sitting.

description.originalText: Caroline was an excellent babysitter we would definitely hire again. Caroline watched our 4mo ("A") while we attended a wedding -- and she was our first non-family babysitter for A since he was born. She was communicative leading up to the job, and very punctual. We asked her to meet A a week ahead of the job to get to know him and he instantly took to her -- it was easy to tell that she had experience with babies (and kids of all ages). As we explained A's routine Caroline was very receptive and asked all of the right questions, but we could also tell that she knew a LOT and that A would be in very good hands. We are very grateful that Caroline babysat for us and look forward to working with her again.

bio.experienceSummary: Hi! My name is Valerie, and I am a speech-language pathologist with a focus on early childhood development. I love working with children and have plenty of experience across all ages ranging from infancy to 12 years (including twin infants). I'm happy to help out in any way I can!

description.originalText: Valerie changed our lives for the better, and made me a more confident and competent first time mom. She taught me so much, and was a blast to have around, to boot. I’d trust her with our lives. Our daughter has outgrown the need for a nanny but if not, we’d keep Valerie forever. Our little girl lit up when her “bestie” walked in every morning and felt safe and had so much fun in her care. Every day was an adventure for them. Anyone would be beyond lucky to have Valerie in their and their child’s lives.

bio.experienceSummary:
My name is Euridice , I'm a 43-year-old mother of two teenage boys. I was born and raised in the Dominican Republic, and moved to Jersey City New Jersey 23 years ago. I'm completely fluent in both English and Spanish.
I have a decade of experience in the child care field, both in a daycare setting, as well as with individual families. I'm confident in my ability to structure and facilitate fun, supportive and age appropriate care for children of all ages.
I love children, and enjoy helping them at each stage of their young lives. (I've maintained close ties to many of my "past" families, and it's a privilege to watch these kids learn and grow!) Principally, I am responsible, caring, creative, and energetic. 
I look forward to meeting your family and helping to create memorable and fun experiences for your little ones.

description.originalText: Euridice was amazing! She was so patient and engaging with my baby boy and I felt comfortable leaving him in her care. Definitely recommend!

bio.experienceSummary: My name is Melody, I am a young energetic sitter. I am a bilingual (Spanish and English) bachelors degree graduate. I have many years of experience caring for children starting in high school with my involvement with the Children's hospital in Washington DC. I have cared for children of all ages. I have a IB Child Development certificate. My favorite thing about being a caretaker is being able to have fun and do creative activities with children! I am a very active person so I love playing sports, going on walks, and even playing pretend! I am very excited to meet your family and I look forward to getting to know you all better!
